cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi SE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the west coast of Florida, then forecast to turn north-northeast across the peninsula and inland into Georgia/South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida (Englewood–Tampa Bay region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect Jupiter Inlet FL northward to Altamaha Sound GA; Florida Keys Seven Mile Bridge–Channel 5 Bridge; Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Englewood–Anclote River including Tampa Bay; Tropical Storm Warning Flamingo–Englewood and lower Keys; Storm-Surge Warning Anclote River–Flamingo including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southwest and west-central Florida coast, Florida Keys, and eventually portions of northeast FL and the southeast U.S. coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Wednesday night through Thursday as Ian passes to the west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on Atlantic side near Port Everglades; surge threat focused on Gulf coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–6 inches with locally higher amounts, creating flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents along the Atlantic beaches.
